meanings.definition: A type of athletic shoe with a rubber sole and canvas upper.
meanings.sent1: I bought a new pair of plims for my gym class.
meanings.sent2: Her plims were comfortable for running on the track.
meanings.sent3: The plims squeaked loudly as he sprinted across the field.
meanings.sent4: The plims danced on the pavement as she practiced her basketball moves.
meanings.sent5: The plims left a trail of dust behind as he raced towards the finish line.

meanings.sent1: She plims through the forest, avoiding branches and rocks.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit plims across the meadow, hopping gracefully.
meanings.sent3: He plims around the house, pretending to be a ninja.
meanings.sent4: The leaves plims in the wind, swirling and twirling.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly plims from flower to flower, sipping nectar along the way.

meanings.sent1: The plims of the balloon bursting startled everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The plims of thunder echoed through the valley during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The plims of the firecracker made the dog bark in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The plims of the car backfiring made him jump in alarm.
meanings.sent5: The plims of the fireworks lit up the night sky with colors and sparks.
